name: Britons
summary: A powerful archery civilization with foot archers that outrange all others. Their Town Centers are cheaper, encouraging early economic growth.

name: Franks
summary: A cavalry powerhouse with extra hitpoints and heavily armored Paladins. Their castles are cheaper, and they have free farm upgrades.

name: Goths
summary: An infantry-spamming civilization that produces units quickly and cheaply. Their infantry get a bonus against buildings.

name: Teutons
summary: A slow but powerful defensive and infantry civilization. Their units have high melee armor, and their towers can garrison more units.

name: Japanese
summary: A strong infantry civilization whose military units attack faster. Their fishing ships have double the hitpoints and work faster.

name: Chinese
summary: A versatile civilization with a strong start. They begin with more villagers but less food. Their technologies are cheaper.

name: Byzantines
summary: A defensive powerhouse with cheaper counter-units and buildings with more hitpoints. Their unique unit is strong against infantry.

name: Persians
summary: An economic and cavalry-focused civilization. They start with extra wood and food and their Town Centers and Docks work faster.

name: Saracens
summary: A civilization with a strong market and powerful camel and naval units. Their archers have an attack bonus against buildings.

name: Turks
summary: A dominant gunpowder civilization. Their gunpowder units have more hitpoints, and their technologies are researched faster.

name: Vikings
summary: A strong naval and infantry civilization. Their warships are cheaper, and their infantry have more hitpoints.

name: Mongols
summary: A fast-paced civilization with excellent cavalry archers and siege units. Their hunters work faster.
